oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and characterization of diphosphine bridged homo and heterometallic clusters containing chalcogen as "naked" atoms
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHATTERJEE, S
PATEL, SK
MOBIN, SM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MIXED-METAL CLUSTERS
NONLINEAR-OPTICAL PROPERTIES
CRYSTAL-STRUCTURES
ACETYLIDE COMPLEXES
CARBONYL CLUSTERS
CO HYDROGENATION
FE
CATALYSTS
LIGANDS
TE
Cluster
Chalcogen
Phosphine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Room temperature reactions of [Fe(3)Te(2)(CO)(8)(PPh(3))] (2) and [(CO)(6)Fe(2)PdY(2)(PPh(3))(2)] (Y = Se (6), Te (7)) with bis-(diphenylphosphino) methane (dppm) in dichloromethane solution led to the formation of a tellurium bridged cluster, [Fe(3)Te(2)(CO)(8)(mu-dppm)] (4) and mixed metal clusters, [(CO)(12)Fe(4)Y(4)Pd(2)(dppm)(2)] (Y = Se (8), Te (9)) respectively. In both the reactions, diphosphine incorporation has taken place by replacing one or two triphenylphosphine ligand. The structures of compounds 4, 6 and 9 were established crystallographically.
